learningObjective: On line 10 choose a relational operator to replace the /* conditional */ so that the Confirm statement evaluates to true
referenceMaterial:
• On Line 5:   Read(I);
    The Read operation takes an integer as input to the program and stores it in variable I

  • On Line 6:   Remember;
    At the point in the code where the Remember statement occurs the value of a variable 'x' is assumed to be #x and this value represented by #x can be referenced in subsequent Confirm statements

  • On Line 8:   I := I + 1;
    The := is the assignment operator, on this line I is assigned the result of evaluating I + 1

  • On Line 10:   /* marks the beginning of a comment and   */ marks the end of a comment

  • On Line 10:   =    <    <=    >    >=
    Are the relational operators from which to choose
